articles.title: Meta Ordered By Italian Regulators To Keep WhatsApp Open For Rival AI Chatbots
articles.mainIdea: Meta Ordered By Italian Regulators To Keep WhatsApp Open For Rival AI Chatbots
articles.summary: Investor's Business Daily: Meta Ordered By Italian Regulators To Keep WhatsApp Open For Rival AI Chatbots. Italian regulators ordered Meta Platforms to keep its WhatsApp messaging platform open to rival chatbots, such as OpenAI's ChatGPT. Meta stock gained a fraction during a shortened trading day. The Italian Competition Authority said Wednesday that a policy change within WhatsApp will "completely exclude Meta AI's competitors" from the platform, once it takes effect Jan. 15. Related tickers mentioned: META, MSFT, OPAI.PVT, PEAI.PVT.

articles.summary: Benzinga: Dave Ramsey Can't Hide His Shock When A Caller Admits Losing $1M In An Investment Scam. Somehow, The Story Didn't End In Total Ruin. On a recent episode of “The Ramsey Show,” a caller from Canada named John stunned hosts Dave Ramsey and George Kamel with a jaw-dropping confession. articles.title: Billionaire Buys AMC Stock Near 52-Week Lows As Avatar Brings Box Office Back To Life
articles.mainIdea: Billionaire Buys AMC Stock Near 52-Week Lows As Avatar Brings Box Office Back To Life
articles.summary: Benzinga: Billionaire Buys AMC Stock Near 52-Week Lows As Avatar Brings Box Office Back To Life. Moviegoers are showing up again. Investors, not so much. Shares of AMC Entertainment Holdings Inc (NYSE:AMC) are down more than 50% year to date, trading around $1.75 — just off 52-week lows — even as the company posts its strongest pre-Christmas weekend since 2021. Attendance surged on the back of “Avatar: Fire and Ash,” with more than four million customers visiting AMC and ODEON locations globally. The disconnect hasn't gone unnoticed. Don't Miss: If there was a new fund backed by Jeff Bezos Related tickers mentioned: AMC.
